meanings.definition: In a reluctant or resentful manner.
meanings.sent1: She completed her chores begrudgingly, dragging her feet the whole time.
meanings.sent2: He begrudgingly agreed to help his friend move, even though he had other plans.
meanings.sent3: The cat begrudgingly allowed the puppy to share its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The old car begrudgingly sputtered to life after sitting in the garage for months.
meanings.sent5: The student begrudgingly trudged through the muddy field during the outdoor science lesson.

meanings.sent1: Her begrudgingly tone made it clear she was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent2: The employee's begrudgingly attitude towards the new policy was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a begrudgingly look at the new kitten invading its territory.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds cast a begrudgingly shadow over the picnic, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's begrudgingly expression softened when the student apologized sincerely.
